xdi2.client.http
Class XDIHttpClient

java.lang.Object
  xdi2.client.http.XDIHttpClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
XDIClient
public class XDIHttpClient
extends Object
implements XDIClient

An XDI client that can send XDI messages over HTTP and receive results. It supports the following parameters (passed to the init method):

  • url - The URL of the XDI endpoint to talk to.
  • sendMimeType - The mime type to use to send the XDI messages to the endpoint. The Content-type header will be set accordingly.
  • recvMimeType - The mime type in which we want to receive the results from the endpoint. The Accept header will be set accordingly. If the endpoint replies in some other mime type than requested, we will still try to read it.

Author:
markus

public MessageResult send(MessageEnvelope messageEnvelope,

Description copied from interface: XDIClient
Sends an XDI message envelope to an XDI endpoint and retrieves the results.

Specified by:
send in interface XDIClient
Parameters:
messageEnvelope - The XDI message envelope to send.
messageResult - The message result that will hold results of the message. If this is null, a new message result will be created.
Returns:
The message result.
